channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid: Difficult winter in Wales if cases keep rising, says doctor
item.description: Public health director Kelechi Nnoaham says everything must be done to stop the rising trend.

item.title: Firefighters tackle blaze at Caerphilly recycling plant
item.description: Residents are asked to close windows and doors because of "an accumulation of smoke".

item.title: Covid: Test, Trace, Protect taking longer to reach positive cases
item.description: Just over 40% of people were reached inside 24 hours in the latest week, down from 88% recently.

item.title: Film: More people needed to work with Hollywood stars
item.description: Forest Whitaker and Tom Hardy have filmed in Wales - but the sector says it needs people to help stars.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: 15-year-old Cardiff sprinter with big dreams
item.description: Sprinter Tomi Roberts-Jones has cerebral palsy and, aged 15, has already represented Wales.

item.title: Covid Q&A: What are the rules for schools in Wales?
item.description: New Welsh government rules are expected to be adopted by schools by 20 September at the latest.

item.title: RSPCA rescue kitten found in car engine after trip from Wales to Leeds
item.description: Tom the six-week-old kitten is lucky not to have been badly injured says the RSPCA.

item.title: Rossett Roman villa archaeological dig gets under way
item.description: It will last three weeks at what is called the first of its kind to be found in north-east Wales.

item.title: Covid: Pupils return to Wales' schools amid concerns
item.description: With Wales at alert level zero, the Welsh government says it will keep an eye on Covid cases.

item.title: Religious groups in UK failing children over sex abuse, report says
item.description: Some leaders in England and Wales discourage reporting abuse to protect reputations, an inquiry finds.

item.title: Barry Biomass hit with order to shut down in planning row
item.description: Campaigners have fought against plans for the wood incinerator for years amid pollution fears.

item.title: Amazon offers punctual staff £50 for turning up
item.description: The online shopping giant says it will give a bonus to workers at some sites for good attendance.

item.title: Caerphilly fire: Firefighters tackle blaze at recycling plant
item.description: The fire service said the blaze involved 200 tonnes of metal and was "well developed".

item.title: Carer shortage leaves Wrexham man 'stranded' in hospital
item.description: Gwyneth Taylor's husband Ronald is unable to go home because of a shortage of carers.

item.title: Drugs: The county lines gang in our Powys cul-de-sac
item.description: What happens when drug dealers move in to a small, rural town?

item.title: Climate change: Meet the people taking action
item.description: A goods swap shop and DIY flood defenders are just some ideas people have put into practice.

item.title: Covid: The doctor busting Covid vaccine myths on social media
item.description: Dr Bnar Talabani has been trying to encourage young people on TikTok to get jabbed.

item.title: Rugby: Mixed ability club in Llanelli marks 25 years
item.description: About half of the club's players are registered disabled and most have learning disabilities.

item.title: Connor Roberts offered new Swansea deal before Burnley move, says Russell Martin
item.description: Russell Martin says Swansea City offered Connor Roberts a new contract before his move to Burnley, while Jamal Lowe expressed a desire to leave.

item.title: James Botham: Cardiff and Wales flanker misses season start after shoulder surgery
item.description: Cardiff flanker James Botham will miss the start of the season and is a doubt for Wales' autumn games after shoulder surgery.

item.title: Dwayne Peel: Scarlets head coach looks forward to number one role
item.description: Scarlets head coach Dwayne Peel admits he is relishing the chance of being in charge of a side for the first time.

item.title: Robert Page: Wales boss pleased with 'positive' draw in Finland
item.description: Wales boss Robert Page says there were a lot of positives from Wednesday's 0-0 friendly draw away to Finland.

item.title: Champions Hockey League: Adler Mannheim 7-2 Cardiff Devils
item.description: Adler Mannheim prove too much for the Cardiff Devils once again as the Elite League side suffer a 7-2 defeat in the Champions Hockey League.

item.title: Gohirio llawdriniaethau dewisol yn y gorllewin
item.description: Bwrdd Iechyd Hywel Dda yn canslo llawdriniaethau orthopedig mewn dau leoliad a chau wardiau mewn un arall.

item.title: Felix Aubel yn ymddiswyddo fel gweinidog pum capel
item.description: Mae'r BBC yn deall bod yna densiynau o fewn ei ofalaeth oherwydd rhai o'i ddaliadau gwleidyddol.

item.title: GIG yng Nghymru'n wynebu 'hydref a gaeaf anodd iawn'
item.description: Cynnydd diweddar yn achosion Covid am gael effaith difrifol ar wasanaethau iechyd, medd doctor blaenllaw.

item.title: Cofio 30 mlynedd ers 'terfysgoedd bara' Trelái
item.description: Tim Hartley fu'n gohebu i'r BBC ar y trais yng Nghaerdydd yn 1991.

item.title: Chwarae da ond dim goliau i Gymru yn erbyn Y Ffindir
item.description: Methodd Harry Wilson gic o'r smotyn wrth i Gymru baratoi ar gyfer gemau nesaf ymgyrch Cwpan y Byd 2022.
